Letters patent granted by Robert the Second, King of Scots, in favour of the Prior and Friars Preachers of Ayr, taking them, their lands, men, and whole possessions and goodS, movable and immovable, ecclesiastical and secular, under his sure peace and protection, prohibiting any one from doing them any injustice under pain of forfeiture, and from seizing their goods or those of their men for the debt, pledge, or forfeit of anyone unless for their own proper debt, pledge, or forfeit, saving the king's burghs ; and straitly charging justiciars, sheriffs, provosts, and their bailies, that they compel all those in their respective jurisdictions who owe debts to these friars, to pay the same without delay. Dated at Perth 15th

February, second year of reign. (1372-3.)
